name: Primal Pappachan
content: Primal PappachanSearchPrimal PappachanAbout meI am an Assistant Professor at Portland State University in the Department of Computer Science. I completed my Ph.D. from the Department of Computer Science at University of California, Irvine. I lead the DIPr üåå (Database & Internet Privacy) Lab and co-organize the Database Reading Group.My research focuses on the intersection of data management and privacy, aiming to enhance user control and data privacy. Specifically, I work on policy-aware data processing to create data management systems that are fast, scalable, transparent, secure, and privacy-preserving.Contact MeVisit the DIPr lab website for details on ongoing projects.Recent NewsAll news¬ª[Nov 2025] I was selected as a Catalyst Immersive fellow for 2025-2026.[Oct 2025] Our PacTrans Proposal ‚ÄúDeveloping SafeSpot: A New Crowdsourcing Tool for Real-Time Near-Miss Detection and Risk Mapping‚Äù was awarded.[Aug 2025] New full research paper titled ‚ÄúMeaningful Data Erasure in the Presence of Dependencies‚Äù accepted at VLDB 2025.[July 2025] My NSF proposal ‚ÄúCRII: SaTC: Preventing inferences in databases through Dependency-Aware Access Control‚Äù was awarded.[June 2025] I gave a talk on ‚ÄúTowards Policy-Aware and Privacy-Conscious Data Management Systems‚Äù as part of Oregon Cybersecurity Center of Excellence (OCCoE) Research Seminar SeriesFeatured PublicationsAll Publications¬ª Primal Pappachan, Chenxi Qiu, Anna Squicciarini, Vishnu Sharma Hunsur Manjunath (2023).
